p: Antitumor activity of THC had been found superior to curcumin in H22 induced ascites tumor mice model. The possible underlying mechanisms that have been suggested were the induction of mitochondria apoptosis pathway, activation of p53, and inhibition of MDM2 [ 75]. Anticancer activities and mechanisms of THC against cervical cancer have been studied in the tumor mice model. It inhibited tumor growth by inducing cell apoptosis and inhibiting cell proliferation, which was likely to happen through the inhibition of COX-2, EGFR, and p-ERK1&2, and p-AKT [ 71]. Antitumor angiogenesis activity of THC in Caski-implanted nude mice occurred by inhibiting HIF-1Î±, microvascular density, VEGF, and VEGFR-2 [ 76].
